annotations:
[('But ”Mr. Two Time Everything”? Is that right?
 So, the presidency? The Super Bowl, did you win that twice?
 Oh, oh, you won two things two times, so you’re the four-time champ
 Well, I’m the prince of 16s, so I’m four times that!', [["Simple math or quantum mechanic battling?

Thesaurus has won 2 titles 2 times, namely the World Rap Championships and Scribble Jam:

2 * 2 = 4

Meanwhile, he claims to be “Two Time Everything” (apart from the implicit imperative contained within the speech act of saying “two time everything!”, ie. inviting the audience to cheat on as many women, tests and life events as humanly possible). But as we all know:

4 ≠ E

which limits Thesaurus' otherwise unlimited name particularly, while defining it clearly in time and space as 4 contingent events.

Now, with Thesaurus' reputation reduced, Rone seeks to equal the winning of titles to contemporary battle bars, so in

4t * 4t =  16t
and
4b ‘* 4b = 16b

we have a full leibnizian identity of indiscernibles, which allows him to produce the formula:

4 * 4 = 16

ie. the same amount as a standard musical verse, which naturally multiplies with x, where x is the amount of musical verses Rone has freestyled, written or recorded.

Rone is now betting or certifying that

4 < x

even if

4 = 1.000.000

seperate bars."]]), ('I’ll wipe the Prince (prints) off of the scene, and they ain’t found a bloody glove yet', [["Rone has claimed himself a prince, awaiting crowning for the throne in previous battles. This entire scheme is a reference to the OJ Simpson murder, where OJ’s finger prints were never found, suggesting they were cleaned, wiped, off the crime scene or he was wearing gloves. The police however did eventually find a glove with the victims' blood on it. In this case, the police won’t find Saurus' glove. So Saurus is going to wipe Rone off the battle rap scene, and not going to be punished."]]), ('Mariota vs. Jameis, Tom Brady versus Peyton', [['Marcus Mariota is an NFL quarterback for the Tennessee Titans, despite being picked behind another NFL QB, Jameis Winston (Tampa Bay) in the 2015 NFL draft, Marcus had a much better rookie year than Winston and his Titans handedly beat the Buccaneers in their first game of the 2015 NFL season, with an outstanding performance from Mariota. Likewise, future hall of famer QB Tom Brady (New England) has dominated fellow future hall of famer Peyton Manning (Indianapolis / Denver) through out their careers in important games. Rone is saying he would be the former option in both of these match-ups, thus the favourite.']]), ('But can Adam test me? Can this nerd stand the pressure?
 Well, that’s a long shot, like the Birdman director', [['The director of Birdman, Alejandro Gonzalez, was known for filming the movie with a series of long camera shots with no edits involved. He’s an example from the film.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=D4qKyNU5u6M']]), ('Plain as black and white, he’ll hit you with some cheesy-ass effects
 Right off the Bat, man that’s exactly why they bringin Adam West', [['Rone’s real name is Adam. He’s from Philadelphia and flew west to Los Angeles for the battle with The Saurus. Adam West is the actor who portrayed Batman in the 60’s. It’s known for it’s “Bang!” “Poof!” “Bam!” sound effects.']]), ('And then both of your cakes', [['As well as this being another fat joke, it also implies that Rone grants Thesaurus not just one, but two cakes, ie. something greater than average (refering to life in general). Thesaurus takes the compliment as seen in the video.']]), ('The shit about you, Penn State, Sandusky? All pretty fuckin’ suspect
 But I won’t talk about you being molested...it’s a really touchy subject', [['Dissing Rone for being molested by Jerry Sandusky has become something trivial, a showcase of unoriginality etc. Thesaurus takes this approach to prove he can write on any topic, and still make it good. So it’s a touchy subject in battle rap, and it would be for Rone, if it had actually happened – and pointing this out would be the correct approach in a more real situation, showing empathy, rather than making jokes about something that serious.']]), ('I don’t have a punchline, just, we know, okay?', [['Thesaurus dedicated a great part of his life to battle rapping and creating punchlines. Rone reminds him that there are other things in life.  Also, the (in some way ironically sick) punchline “we know”, could simultaneously mean that they both – him and Thesaurus – know.

Know what? you ask. All the trickeries of lyrical swordsmithery, and thus that they both understand – and this is in some way reaching out, from the perspective of one rapper dissing another – the sub rosa level of the text. And therefore putting the opponent on equal footing. Like saying “but fuck all the bullshit for a second …”

Coming off the half difficult language breakdown and going into dissing Thesaurus for his mental abilities, as explained above, this is also a nice way of declaring truce, or making it clear that it’s all fun and games.']]), ('You sound like a fag; you put the homo in homonym', [['Meta awareness of the text. Rone is using something close to homonyms, since his rhymes sound the same but have different meanings (homonyms are also spelled the same, but since it’s rap, which is 100% verbal, homonyms or lets call it homonymic flow can basically pass as defining the trend of saying the same words, but attributing different meanings to them). This is another way of Rone saying – to “Thesaurus” – that he knows a lot of words, basically defining a battle rap trend in one rhyme.']]), ('But you the type to fall in love with a whore named Cinnamon
 Whore, The Saurus, ain’t that a synonym of a girl that’ll sin on ’im?', [["This has to do with Thesaurus' style. That Rone is the fastest eye-ta'ian means that he is the fastest/sharpest/best at using language. The whore named Cinnamon is basically a metaphore for Thesaurus' style. The reason Rone then does the imitated slow-it-down is to exhibit a creative and highly stylistic flow, that plays on a basic battle rap trend, but with such skill that nobody saw it comming and without it being forced. Saying “you can’t style like this, though” and staying in a language-/word breakdown in the following bars, both to style on the trend of saying the same word with different meanings, but also in a way to say “yeah, your name is Thesaurus, but when it comes to this word shit, you ain’t got shit on me”."]])]
